question: <image 1>For the four identical current-carrying wires shown (with conventional current coming out of the plane of the page), the wire on the right is labeled P. What is the direction of the total magnetic force on the wire labeled P that is caused by the other wires?
options: ['To the left', 'To the right', 'Towards the top of the page', 'There is no force.']
description: The image shows four identical current-carrying wires arranged in a square pattern. Each wire has a conventional current flowing out of the plane of the page, indicated by the small circles with dots inside them. The wire on the right side of the square is labeled "P." The other three wires are labeled "4A" and are positioned at the top, bottom left, and bottom right corners of the square.
